page.title: 10SANDHURST VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: THE PROBLEM OF FALLING NUMBERS Sandhurst Church of England Primary School faces closure in 1987. At 22 the number of children on roll is consid- ered too small and next year there will be even fewer. Such small numbers raise problems, for example there are only 4 boys in the school football team. The infants are taught in a separate temporary classroom and the 16 juniors are together in the main schoolroom. School dinners are also eaten in this room, they are cooked in Gloucester and brought in daily by a van. All ages mix well, community spirit is an important result of life in a small rural school. This will be lost if the children have to travel away to another school. Unless more families with young children move to Sandhurst it will be impossible to save the school although the villagers want to keep it open.
